alert.note: Alert for Latimer; Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 17 at 2:22PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is likely in some areas. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in Arkansas, Benton, Carroll, Crawford, Franklin, Madison, Sebastian and Washington AR. In Oklahoma, Adair, Cherokee, Haskell, Latimer, Le Flore, McIntosh, Muskogee, Pittsburg and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Some creeks and streams will likely rise out of their banks. River flooding will be possible, especially in the Illinois river basin. Low-water crossings will likely become flooded with extensive street flooding in some locations. Area creeks and streams are running high and will flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A frontal boundary located just south of I-40 will stall later this afternoon. Strong lift along with record precipitable water values, and the potential for training of storms will lead to a zone of heavy rainfall through tonight across the watch area. Widespread 3-4 inches with localized 5-6 inch amounts are possible. A few areas that receive the highest rainfall totals could experience significant flooding. The flooding threat will begin to decrease late tonight as storms shift southeast of the region. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
